Posts.Content: nanbvns wrote: I was diagnosed with mets to both hip last July, since then I have had an MRI that showed extensive areas of disease in my spine. My doctor didn't explain any of the results with me other than to say I had an area in the middle of my back. I found my MRI results on my portal and saw otherwise.Â  I don't want to be be a pest, but I don't have another scheduled appointment for 6 weeks. Is it alright to make an appointment for a face to face and discuss my condition? Dx 1/2008, IDC, 6cm+, Stage IIIA, Grade 3, 7/22 nodes, ER+/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Calling oncologist and making appointment to ask questions. nanbvns car2tenn

Posts.Content: nanbvns wrote: I have bone mets in hips and back and I now have a large lump above my right knee and a large lump on the outside of my left ankle, no injury or trauma. Does anyone have any thoughts on this before I call my doctor. I was diagnosed with bi-lateral breast cancer with nodes positive 6 years ago and had bi-lateral mastectomy, lots of chemo and radiation. Now I'm worried about the lumps being from the radiation. Dx 1/2008, IDC, 6cm+, Stage IIIA, Grade 3, 7/22 nodes, ER+/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Strange lumpsI nanbvns AmyQ
